name: DictMySQL
tagline: A MySQL class for more convenient database manipulation with Python dictionary.
body: #Table of Contents [SELECT](#select) [[SELECT|select]] [[UPDATE|update]] [[INSERT|insert]] [[UPSERT|upsert]] [[DELETE|delete]] ## select ## ```python from dictmysqldb import DictMySQLdb db = DictMySQLdb(db='occupation', host='127.0.0.1', passwd='', user='root') db.select(table='jobs', columns=['id','value'], where={'$OR': [{'value': {'$LIKE': 'Artist%'}}, {'id': 10}]}) # SELECT `id`, `value` FROM `jobs` WHERE (`value` LIKE "Artist%") OR (`id` = 10); ```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
